title: SQL ServerCOT()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerCOT()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the cotangent of a number:
SELECT COT(6);

Definition and Usage
The COT() function returns the cotangent of a number.
Syntax
COT(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the cotangent of a number:
SELECT COT(-2);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerCOT()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerCOT()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerCOT()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
